about.title: About Me
about.description: Computer Engineering graduate specializing in Embedded Systems and Robotics
content: Hello! I'm Amr Eslim, a Computer Engineering graduate based in Berlin, Germany.
I recently completed my Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering at HTW Berlin (April 2025) with a focus on embedded systems.
My expertise lies in embedded systems with Linux, software development, and web application development.
I have hands-on experience as a software development working student at Fraunhofer IPK since May 2022.
With a strong background in C/C++, Python, and embedded systems, I build reliable and efficient solutions.
I'm particularly interested in developing robotics systems that can seamlessly integrate with digital assistance systems.
Let's build the future of robotics and embedded systems together!

snake_robot.title: Neurobiologically-Inspired Snake Robot
snake_robot.subtitle: Bachelor Thesis – HTW Berlin (2025)
snake_robot.description: This project presents the design, implementation, and testing of a modular snake-like robot inspired by biological snake locomotion. It reproduces lateral undulation and sidewinding using a Central Pattern Generator (CPG) control model, built entirely from scratch for the thesis 'Neurobiologically-inspired Control of a Robot.' The robot integrates mechanical engineering, embedded programming, and motion neuroscience into a functional bio-inspired system.
features: ✅ **Mechanical Design**: Built in Onshape CAD and 3D-printed with TPU friction scales and PLA+ wheels. Alternating servo layout (horizontal/vertical) for complex out-of-plane motion.
✅ **Control System**: CPG control based on a phase-coupled oscillator model. Implements two gaits – lateral undulation and sidewinding – driven by sinusoidal position updates at 50Hz.

✅ **Microcontroller & Power**: ESP32 used for real-time web-based control and Wi-Fi AP mode. Each of the 10 servo segments includes a local buck converter with capacitive filtering for noise suppression.
✅ **Web Interface**: Developed in React.js and served over Wi-Fi from ESP32. Allows live tuning of motion parameters (amplitude, frequency, phase offset) and toggling of movement direction.
✅ **Testing & Evaluation**: Experimental trials conducted on laminate flooring. Multiple configurations (base, TPU scales, PLA+ wheels) were compared using video tracking and current sensors.
✅ **Motion Tracking**: Kinovea used to track head/tail motion. Data exported to CSV and visualized in React-based plots, showing performance differences across configurations and gaits.

✅ **Energy Profiling**: Current draw was measured using ACS712 sensor. Sidewinding was found to consume ~50% more current than lateral undulation, with PLA+ wheels offering the most consistent performance.
✅ **Robust Control Architecture**: Uses mathematical oscillator model (θk = A·cos(2πft + φk)) for each servo. Oscillator phase relationships enable direction control and motion symmetry.

✅ **Design Evolution**: Replaced an earlier STM32 version with ESP32 for better connectivity and real-time tuning. Power distribution was redesigned for servo isolation, and mechanical tolerances were iteratively improved.
✅ **Future Work**: The thesis proposes improvements like ESP-NOW-based swarm collaboration, autonomous direction control using IMUs, and flexible soft-body actuation for terrain adaptation.
